intro: Acer opalus var. stenopterum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf maple, is a deciduous tree characterized by its finely serrated, elongated leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in autumn. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters, featuring a rounded crown and smooth, light grey bark. Its small, yellowish-green flowers appear in early spring, followed by winged samaras that disperse its seeds.
